string.text: BuyPatrols WARNING: DESTROYING ALL PATROLS DAILY OPTION ENABLED.
There are {PATROLSREMAINING} patrols remaining and are currently in engagement.

The {BASILPATROL_SETTLEMENT_TYPE} says they have the manpower but not the gear to send men on patrols. He tells he can send up to {BASILPATROL_MAX_PATROL_AMOUNT} patrols if you are willing to pay their gear. Your clan must own the village to hire patrols. Patrols will switch allegiance to the new clan owner if ownership changes. Disbanding patrols will only affect patrols that are not engaging an enemy. You can have a total of {BASILPATROLS_CAP_PATROLS} patrols in your clan. You have {BASILPATROLS_CAP_LEFT} patrols you can still hire for your clan.
You have hired a patrol at {BUYPATROLSCURRENTSETTLEMENT}.
Hello my lord. What do you need us to do?
We are patrolling around {BASILPATROL_AREA} under commands of {BASILPATROLS_LIEGE_0}. What do you want?
I didn't stutter. Surrender or die!
Stop right there! You're an enemy of {BASILPATROLS_LIEGE} and we shall capture you.
We can do this the easy way or the hard way.
When enabled, will attempt to delete ALL patrols that aren't engaging a party. This might take several days. Will notify the number of patrols left and destroyed.
When enabled, will attempt to remove duplicate lords and their parties.
When enabled, all patrols will target caravans.
When enabled, all patrols will target villagers.
Sets the type of troops that patrols will be comprised of.
When enabled, all patrols will gain bonus speed from the add patrol speed option.
When enabled, all daily patrols wages will be included the clan expenses. When it is disabled, patrol wages will be notified on the bottom left.
When enabled, will send a notification on the bottom left when a personal patrol has been destroyed. Only applies for new patrols.
The bonus speed that will be added to patrols within your clan.
Modifies the daily wage amount. 0 makes it so there are no patrol wages to pay.
Modifies the max amount of patrols that players can have at one time. The more patrols in your map can cause unforeseen bugs and issues.
Modifies the max amount of patrols per village.
Modifies the max amount of patrols per castle.
Modifies the max amount of patrols per town.
Modifies the base average men per patrol. This affects all sizes. Medium is 2x and large is 3x this number
When enabled, a daily 10% chance to gain relation with notables that have patrols.
When enabled, will send a notification on each relation change due to having patrols.
The relation cap for having patrols per notable. Relation gain will stop after reaching this value.
When enabled, forces patrols to be capped at large patrol size. Will randomly remove troops over the large patrol size.
When enabled, allows patrols to slowly regenerate on a daily basis up to large size.
The maximum distance a patrol will go before being pulled back to their home settlement.
When enabled, other lords will try to hire patrols for their all of their settlements.
The daily chance that other lords will hire a patrol per village if it is below the settlement limit.
If a village's hearth is below this number, the lord will run the chance to spawn a patrol for it.
If a castle's prosperity is below this number, the lord will run the chance to spawn a patrol for it.
If a town's prosperity is below this number, the lord will run the chance to spawn a patrol for it.
The bonus speed that will be added to AI hired patrols.
The maximum amount of patrols the AI will hire per settlement.
The base cost to patrols. The total cost of hiring a patrol is a combination of base cost + hearth or base cost + prosperity.
The base amount of patrols the AI will hire under their clan. This is added to their current clan tier for the cap.
When enabled, other lords will try to hire patrols for their villages.
When enabled, other lords will try to hire patrols for their castles.
When enabled, other lords will try to hire patrols for their towns.
You have no money for any patrols.
BuyPatrols WARNING: REMOVING ALL DUPE LORDS.
